title: 107_s1942
content: The "Biodiesel Promotion Act of 2002" provides incentives for biodiesel use as fuel through a new section in the Internal Revenue Code. The Biodiesel Promotion Act of 2002 offers incentives for biodiesel use as fuel through a new section in the Internal Revenue Code. The biodiesel fuels credit is determined based on the biodiesel mixture credit, which calculates the credit amount for each taxpayer by multiplying the biodiesel mixture rate by the number of gallons of qualified biodiesel mixture used in the taxable year. The biodiesel mixture rate is 1 cent for each whole percentage point of biodiesel in the mixture, up to 20 percentage points. The biodiesel mixture rate for each qualified biodiesel mixture is 1 cent for each whole percentage point of biodiesel in the mixture, up to 20 percentage points. A qualified biodiesel mixture is a blend of diesel and biodiesel sold or used by the taxpayer producing it as a fuel in their trade or business. The credit for biodiesel production is only applicable if the sale or use is in the taxpayer's trade or business, and not for casual off-farm production. Coordination with the exemption from excise tax is also considered for the biodiesel credit. The biodiesel credit is not applicable to casual off-farm production and is reduced to account for any benefit from excise tax exemptions. Biodiesel is defined as monoalkyl esters of long chain fatty acids from virgin vegetable oils for use in diesel engines. The term "biodiesel" refers to monoalkyl esters derived from various vegetable oils for use in diesel engines. It must meet registration requirements set by the EPA and ASTM D6751. The Clean Air Act and ASTM D6751 set requirements for biodiesel. If biodiesel is separated from a qualified mixture or used for purposes other than fuel, a tax is imposed. A tax is imposed on biodiesel that is separated from a qualified mixture or used for purposes other than fuel. The tax is calculated based on the biodiesel mixture rate and the number of gallons in the mixture. Applicable laws and penalties apply to this tax as if it were imposed under a different section. Rules for estates and trusts are also outlined by the Secretary. The tax on biodiesel is imposed based on the biodiesel mixture rate and the number of gallons. Rules for estates and trusts apply under regulations prescribed by the Secretary. Taxpayers can elect to have the biodiesel fuels credit not apply for any taxable year. The biodiesel fuels credit election must be made by the deadline without extensions, as per regulations. The section does not apply to fuel sold after December 31, 2012. The credit is now part of the general business credit under Section 38(b) of the Code. Conforming amendments have been made to Section 39(d) of the Code. The biodiesel fuels credit under Section 40A cannot be carried back before January 1, 2003, as per the new conforming amendments to the Code. The biodiesel fuels credit under Section 40A is amended by striking certain paragraphs, adding new paragraphs, and making conforming amendments to the Code. The amendments made by Section 40A regarding biodiesel fuels credit and the reduction of motor fuel excise taxes on biodiesel mixtures will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2002. Section 4081 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include regulations for biodiesel mixtures, reducing the tax rate for qualified mixtures. The tax rate for diesel fuel used in producing qualified biodiesel mixtures is reduced by the biodiesel mixture rate applicable to the mixture. The tax rate for diesel fuel used in producing qualified biodiesel mixtures is reduced by the biodiesel mixture rate. Definitions and rules from section 40A apply to this subsection. Conforming amendments are made to Section 4041 for biodiesel mixtures. The tax rates for biodiesel mixtures are reduced under specific regulations. Conforming amendments are made to Sections 4041 and 6427 of the Code. The tax rates for biodiesel mixtures are reduced under specific regulations, with amendments made to Sections 4041 and 6427 of the Code. A new subsection (p) is added, stating that the Secretary will pay an amount equal to the per gallon applicable biodiesel mixture rate for diesel fuel used in producing qualified biodiesel mixtures. Effective from December 31, 2002, to January 1, 2013, the amendments apply to fuel sold during this period. Transfers are made from the Commodity Credit Corporation funds to ensure the Highway Trust Fund is held harmless. The amendments made to Sections 4041 and 6427 of the Code reduce tax rates for biodiesel mixtures. A new subsection (p) specifies payments by the Secretary for diesel fuel used in producing qualified biodiesel mixtures. Effective from December 31, 2002, to January 1, 2013, transfers from the Commodity Credit Corporation funds ensure the Highway Trust Fund is unaffected by the reductions in receipts.
